keyword: how many calories is in a stick of butter
title: How Many Calories in a Stick of Butter?
meta_description: Learn how many calories is in a stick of butter (about 810 kcal), with full nutrition facts, fat breakdown, sodium, and tweaks for light or whipped varieties.
h1: How Many Calories in a Stick of Butter?
assumptions: Salted butter, standard US stick (113 g or 4 oz, 1/2 cup volume).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, salted vs. unsalted, fat content, and processing; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard stick of butter provides about 810 calories, primarily from saturated fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories is in a stick of butter?
faqs.a: Approximately 810 kcal for a standard 113 g salted stick.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a stick of butter?
faqs.a: About 92 g total fat, including 58 g saturated fat.

faqs.q: Does unsalted butter have fewer calories?
faqs.a: No, calories are the same (~810 kcal); only sodium differs (about 11 mg vs. 607 mg).

faqs.q: How many calories in a tablespoon of butter?
faqs.a: One tablespoon (about 14 g) has roughly 100 kcal; a stick is 12 tablespoons.
Yes, a stick contains 243 mg cholesterol, mostly from the fat content.
